verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.
verses.verse_html: 1And it came to pass, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when Samuel

verses.text_plain: Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abiah: they were judges in Beer–sheba.
verses.verse_html: 2Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abiah: they were judges in Beer–sheba.

verses.text_plain: And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.
verses.verse_html: 3And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.

verses.text_plain: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel unto Ramah,
verses.verse_html: 4Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel unto Ramah,

verses.text_plain: And said unto him, Behold, thou art old, and thy sons walk not in thy ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.
verses.verse_html: 5And said unto him, Behold, thou art old, and thy sons walk not in thy ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.

tokens.text: unto him, Behold, thou art old

verses.text_plain: But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
6But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto the Lord. ▼
▼ displeased: Heb. was evil in the eyes of

footnotes.body_text: ▼ displeased: Heb. was evil in the eyes of
footnotes.body_html: ▼ displeased: Heb. was evil in the eyes of

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee: for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected me, that I should not reign over them.
verses.verse_html: 7And the Lord said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee: for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected me, that I should not reign over them.

tokens.text: unto thee: for they have not rejected
me, that I should not reign

verses.text_plain: According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day, wherewith they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so do they also unto thee.
verses.verse_html: 8According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day, wherewith they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so do they also unto thee.

verses.text_plain: Now therefore hearken unto their voice: howbeit yet protest solemnly unto them, and shew them the manner of the king that shall reign over them.
verses.verse_html:
9Now therefore hearken unto their voice: howbeit yet protest solemnly unto them, and shew them the manner of the king that shall reign over them. ▼
▼ hearken…: or, obey
 , ▼
▼ howbeit…: or, notwithstanding when thou hast solemnly protested against them then thou shalt

footnotes.body_text: ▼ howbeit…: or, notwithstanding when thou hast solemnly protested against them then thou shalt
footnotes.body_html: ▼ howbeit…: or, notwithstanding when thou hast solemnly protested against them then thou shalt

verses.text_plain: And Samuel told all the words of the Lord unto the people that asked of him a king.
verses.verse_html: 10And Samuel told all the words of the Lord unto the people that asked of him a king.

verses.text_plain: And he said, This will be the manner of the king that shall reign over you: He will take your sons, and appoint them for himself, for his chariots, and to be his horsemen; and some shall run before his chariots.
verses.verse_html: 11And he said, This will be the manner of the king that shall reign over you: He will take your sons, and appoint them for himself, for his chariots, and to be his horsemen; and some shall run before his chariots.

verses.text_plain: And he will appoint him captains over thousands, and captains over fifties; and will set them to ear his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and instruments of his chariots.
verses.verse_html: 12And he will appoint him captains over thousands, and captains over fifties; and will set them to ear his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and instruments of his chariots.

verses.text_plain: And he will take your daughters to be confectionaries, and to be cooks, and to be bakers.
verses.verse_html: 13And he will take your daughters to be confectionaries, and to be cooks, and to be bakers.

verses.text_plain: And he will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your oliveyards, even the best of them, and give them to his servants.
verses.verse_html: 14And he will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your oliveyards, even the best of them, and give them to his servants.

verses.text_plain: And he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants.
verses.verse_html:
15And he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants. ▼
▼ officers: Heb. eunuchs

tokens.text: And he will take the tenth

verses.text_plain: And he will take your menservants, and your maidservants, and your goodliest young men, and your asses, and put them to his work.
verses.verse_html: 16And he will take your menservants, and your maidservants, and your goodliest young men, and your asses, and put them to his work.

verses.text_plain: He will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be his servants.
verses.verse_html: 17He will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be his servants.

tokens.text: and ye shall be his servants

verses.text_plain: And ye shall cry out in that day because of your king which ye shall have chosen you; and the Lord will not hear you in that day.
verses.verse_html: 18And ye shall cry out in that day because of your king which ye shall have chosen you; and the Lord will not hear you in that day.

verses.text_plain: Nevertheless the people refused to obey the voice of Samuel; and they said, Nay; but we will have a king over us;
verses.verse_html: 19Nevertheless the people refused to obey the voice of Samuel; and they said, Nay; but we will have a king over us;

tokens.text: Nay; but we will have a king

verses.text_plain: That we also may be like all the nations; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.
verses.verse_html: 20That we also may be like all the nations; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.

tokens.text: That we also may be like all the nations

verses.text_plain: And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 21And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of the Lord.

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said to Samuel, Hearken unto their voice, and make them a king. And Samuel said unto the men of Israel, Go ye every man unto his city.
verses.verse_html: 22And the Lord said to Samuel, Hearken unto their voice, and make them a king. And Samuel said unto the men of Israel, Go ye every man unto his city.
